definition: to be available at any time/to be on call
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Doctor Liu is on call at all times.
sentences.chinese: 不論什麼時候劉醫生隨叫隨到。

sentences.english: My job entails being on call 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作需要一天24小時隨叫隨到。

sentences.english: Do I need to be available twenty four hours a day?
sentences.chinese: 我真的需要每天24小時隨叫隨到嗎？

sentences.english: The price actual benefit, the service arriving, is within call.
sentences.chinese: 價格實惠，服務到位，隨叫隨到。

sentences.english: I am always just a phone call away.
sentences.chinese: 只要您一個電話，我隨叫隨到。

sentences.english: For six weeks out of the year, I'm on 24/7 on-call duty.
sentences.chinese: 一年有六個星期，我必須全天候隨叫隨到。

sentences.english: Guarantee arrival at site called in case refrigeratory is failure.
sentences.chinese: 冷庫出現故障，保證作到隨叫隨到。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
lookout post/sentry
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
switchboard operator
to look for trouble
to throw the dice
bird's nest
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
